articles.headline: The Final Blocks: Inside Ukraine’s Bloody Stand for Bakhmut
articles.snippet: Pushed into a shrinking corner of the devastated city, the Ukrainian military is determined to hold out for strategic reasons, even as allies question the cost.
articles.abstract: Pushed into a shrinking corner of the devastated city, the Ukrainian military is determined to hold out for strategic reasons, even as allies question the cost.
articles.lead_paragraph: After 10 months of one of the longest and bloodiest battles in Russia’s war in Ukraine, Ukrainian soldiers are now defending a shrinking half-circle of ruins in a western neighborhood of Bakhmut, only about 20 blocks wide and continually pounded with artillery.
articles.byline: By Andrew E. Kramer and Mauricio Lima

articles.headline: Judge Imposes Sanction on Fox for Withholding Evidence in Defamation Case
articles.snippet: Judge Eric Davis also said an investigation was likely into Fox’s handling of documents and whether it had withheld details about Rupert Murdoch’s corporate role.
articles.abstract: Judge Eric Davis also said an investigation was likely into Fox’s handling of documents and whether it had withheld details about Rupert Murdoch’s corporate role.
articles.lead_paragraph: WILMINGTON, Del. — The judge overseeing Dominion Voting Systems’ lawsuit against Fox News said on Wednesday that he was imposing a sanction on the network and would very likely start an investigation into whether Fox’s legal team had deliberately withheld evidence, scolding the lawyers for not being “straightforward” with him.
articles.byline: By Katie Robertson and Jeremy W. Peters

articles.headline: New Leaked Documents Show Broad Infighting Among Russian Officials
articles.snippet: The additional documents also suggest the breach of American intelligence agencies could contain far more material than previously believed.
articles.abstract: The additional documents also suggest the breach of American intelligence agencies could contain far more material than previously believed.
articles.lead_paragraph: The depth of the infighting inside the Russian government appears broader and deeper than previously understood, judging from a newly discovered cache of classified intelligence documents that has been leaked online.
articles.byline: By Anton Troianovski, Aric Toler, Julian E. Barnes, Christiaan Triebert and Malachy Browne

articles.headline: Landmark Trial Against Fox News Could Affect the Future of Libel Law
articles.snippet: Jury selection starts on Thursday in Delaware Superior Court, where the proceedings will tackle misinformation and the limits of journalistic responsibility.
articles.abstract: Jury selection starts on Thursday in Delaware Superior Court, where the proceedings will tackle misinformation and the limits of journalistic responsibility.
articles.lead_paragraph: Dominion Voting Systems’ defamation case against Fox News, which goes to trial in Delaware next week, is expected to stoke hot-button debates over journalistic ethics, the unchecked flow of misinformation, and the ability of Americans to sort out facts and falsehoods in a polarized age.

articles.headline: If Tennessee’s Legislature Looks Broken, It’s Not Alone
articles.snippet: State legislatures around the country — plagued by partisan division, uncompetitive races and gerrymandering — reflect the current pressures on democracy.
articles.abstract: State legislatures around the country — plagued by partisan division, uncompetitive races and gerrymandering — reflect the current pressures on democracy.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — There are 99 legislators in the Tennessee House of Representatives, the body that voted on Thursday to expel two of its Democratic members for leading an anti-gun protest in the chamber.

articles.headline: Inside the Online Market for Overseas Abortion Pills
articles.snippet: For-profit sellers are meeting the demand for unregulated abortion pills — one that will only grow if legal access in the U.S. is further restricted.
articles.abstract: For-profit sellers are meeting the demand for unregulated abortion pills — one that will only grow if legal access in the U.S. is further restricted.
articles.lead_paragraph: For-profit sellers are meeting the demand for unregulated abortion pills — one that will only grow if legal access in the U.S. is further restricted.

articles.headline: Dour Earnings Loom Over Wall St. as a Slowing Economy Bites
articles.snippet: The outlook for corporate profits has swiftly deteriorated, with inflation still fast and a banking scare prompting some investor caution.
articles.abstract: The outlook for corporate profits has swiftly deteriorated, with inflation still fast and a banking scare prompting some investor caution.
articles.lead_paragraph: As the country’s largest companies prepare to report their results for the start of the year — offering a view into how the economy is faring as a banking shock reverberates — they’re already warning investors to brace themselves.

articles.headline: Yes, People Will Pay $27,500 for an Old ‘Rocky’ Tape. Here’s Why.
articles.snippet: Collectors are finding that their childhood has a price — and it’s going up. When the future is frightening, it’s boom times at the nostalgia factory.
articles.abstract: Collectors are finding that their childhood has a price — and it’s going up. When the future is frightening, it’s boom times at the nostalgia factory.
articles.lead_paragraph: Just about everyone has somewhere special they went when young, a place that glows in memory. For some it may be a library or game arcade, for others a baseball field or bookstore. For Jay Carlson, growing up in western Massachusetts in the early 1990s, the center of the universe was the video rental store.

articles.headline: In Fox-Dominion Trial, All Eyes Are on the Judge, Too
articles.snippet: Judge Eric Davis of Delaware Superior Court has been evenhanded and reasonable, legal analysts say. The defamation suit is his highest-profile case.
articles.abstract: Judge Eric Davis of Delaware Superior Court has been evenhanded and reasonable, legal analysts say. The defamation suit is his highest-profile case.
articles.lead_paragraph: As Fox News heads to trial to defend itself against a $1.6 billion lawsuit, which could prove a critical gauge of free speech protections in an age of politicized misinformation, the presiding judge faces a high-profile test of his abilities in the middle of a media spectacle.
